frameDefinitions: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
An Agent or Cause causes a Sleeper to transition from the Sleep_state to wakeful consciousness.
An Entity is presented as having been seen or experienced by a (typically generic and backgrounded)
An Entity survives a situation with some Support, which tends to be far below the accustomed or standard level expected.
Some Stimulus causes a Cognizer to think of a prior Phenomenon due to its perceived similarity.
A Speaker addresses an Addressee with a Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a Topic.
frameExamples: Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
The earthquake <t>woke</t> me from a nightmare.
Susanna Fulton's work is <t>new</t> to me.
Harry <t>subsisted</t> on ramen and cheap beer through college.
I burned down the malt shop where we used to go just because it <t>reminds</t> me of you
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The person or being that is sleeping.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A concrete thing or abstract phenomenon or fact that is assessed in terms of how well recognizable it is to a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The (typically non-specific and backgrounded) sentient being for whom the <fen>Entity</fen> possesses a specified level of recognizability.
The deviation of the actual level of recognizability of the <fen>Entity</fen> from the level specified by the target.
The living organism which requires the <fen>Support</fen> to survive.
The resource that the <fen>Entity</fen> relies on to survive through a situation.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who remembers the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> .
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the mental content that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers.
The entity or situation that causes the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to think of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the Cognizer remembers the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>.
This role is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs  the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
He gave <fex>an address</fex> quite familiar to the chauffeur.
The information used to illustrate the concept is familiar <fex>to the reader</fex>.
He gave an address <fex>quite</fex> familiar to the chauffeur.
<fex>He</fex> lived on peanuts until she came along.
Harry managed to subsist <fex>on ramen and cheap beer</fex> through college.
You remind me <fex>of my uncle Jerry</fex>
<fex>Internationalization</fex> conjures up a world of diplomatic exchanges and international agencies in which the interests of ex-colonial and great powers still linger
<fex>Bill</fex> told me that he would come to the party.
The authorities informed me <fex>that my brother had been arrested</fex>.
Leroy told his mother <fex>about his arrest</fex>.

Even when we had a size problem they informed me <fex>right away</fex> and everything worked
out great.
She looked at it for a few moments, thinking of Mark Smeaton and what he had told her <fex>on the steps of City Hall</fex>.
